#Text=County Fermanagh
#Text=County Fermanagh ( Irish : Contae Fhear Manach ) is a largely rural county in the south-west of Northern Ireland and is famed for its numerous lakes .
#Text=County Fermanagh belongs to the province of Ulster and is one of the six counties that form Northern Ireland .
#Text=It is Northern Ireland ’s western most county and covers an area of 1,691 km ² .
#Text=Its capital ( County Town ) is Enniskillen housing the tourist attractions of Enniskillen Castle , Cole 's Monument , the Ardhowen Theatre and Saint Macartin 's Cathedral .
#Text=County Fermanagh is a rural area and therefore agriculture and tourism are the most important industries .
#Text=The agricultural land is mainly used for hay and grazing than for other crops .
#Text=The two lakes Upper Lough Erne and Lower Lough Erne are separated by the county 's capital and linked to the river Shannon .
#Text=Towns
#Text=( Inis Ceithleann , " Ceithlenn 's island " ) – situated between the Upper and Lower sections of Lough Erne
#Text=Villages
#Text=( Béal Átha na Mallacht , " ford-mouth of the curses " )
#Text=( Béal Cú , " mouth of the narrow stretch of water " ) - and Florencecourt : Florence Court , the Marble Arch Caves
#Text=( Béal Leice , " mouth of the flagstones " ) - with Belleek Pottery , the oldest pottery in Ireland producing the finest china .
#Text=( Baile an Irbhinigh ) - with Necarne Castle and Castle Archdale
#Text=( Ceis , " wicker bridge " )
#Text=( Lios Béal Átha , " ringfort at the ford-mouth " )
#Text=( Lios na Scéithe , " fort of the shield " ) and the Crom Estate
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=By plane
#Text=There are three main airports in Northern Ireland .
#Text=Both ( BFS ) and ( BHD ) are a 2 hour drive away .
#Text=( LDY ) is 1h 45min away .
#Text=Alternatively ( DUB ) is about 2.5h drive from Fermanagh and many like to combine seeing both the beauty and culture of both Southern as well as Northern Ireland .
#Text=By boat
#Text=Many travellers from the UK like to avail of the frequent ferry services operating between Britain and Northern Ireland .
#Text=Belfast Port and the ferry into Larne are popular points of entry .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Many like the freedom of self-drive tours of Northern Ireland .
#Text=AA Route Planner is a good resource for planning your travel routes .
#Text=You drive on the left hand side of the well maintained roads in Northern Ireland .
#Text=For those you prefer to leave the car at home Northern Ireland has excellent bus services .
#Text=Review
#Text=Translink or Bus Eireann -(for bus services to and from Southern Ireland )
#Text=Buy
#Text=Pounds sterling ( £ ) is the local currency .
#Text=Due to the county 's proximity to the Republic of Ireland , Euros ( € ) are accepted by many retailers , but only notes , never coins .
#Text=Most retailers and establishments will display if they accept Euro or not , but it is advisable to have your money changed to the local currency .
#Text=Eat
#Text=You would look at spending about £5-7 on " pub grub " for lunch in a bar .
#Text=Budget for about £20 for a main course meal in a mid price restaurant in the evenings .
#Text=B&Bs and Guesthouses
#Text=There are a number of high quality B&Bs/family run guesthouses in Fermanagh to select from .
#Text=Expect to pay around £20-30 per person on average .
#Text=With over 58 properties on offer this is the preferred method of accommodation for most visiting Fermanagh looking for value .
#Text=Hostels
#Text=For those on a budget , hostels are a cheaper option but have less coverage than B&Bs .
#Text=There are only 4 hostels - The Bridges Youth Hostel , Lough Melvin Holiday Centre , Tir Navar and Share Centre .
#Text=Hotels
#Text=There are only about 11 hotels operating in Fermanagh , ranging from 2 to 4 star
#Text=Holiday rentals
#Text=For groups and larger families
#Text=there are over 180 self-catering choices on offer so you will be spoilt for choice .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=You be surprised to hear that Fermanagh has the second lowest crime rate in Europe .
#Text=Even during the height of the " troubles " and civil rights movement
#Text=Fermanagh tourist attractions were hardly affected .
#Text=The unrest of the 70s and 80s have become a thing of the past in recent years .
#Text=Go next
#Text=North East to County Tyrone
#Text=North West to County Donegal , Ireland
#Text=South East to County Monaghan , Ireland
#Text=South West to County Leitrim , Ireland
#Text=South to County Cavan , Ireland
